content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Certainly! Below is a function `extract_julia_code` in Julia that extracts all Julia code blocks from a Markdown document, removes the code fences, and joins the code blocks together with a newline.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    julia_code_blocks = String[]
    in_code_block = false
    lang_detected = false
    
    for line in eachline(md)
        if occursin(r"^```", line)
            if in_code_block
                # Close code block
                in_code_block = false
                lang_detected = false
            else
                # Detect language
                if occursin(r"^```julia", line)
                    lang_detected = true
                end
                in_code_block = true
            end
        elseif in_code_block && lang_detected
            push!(julia_code_blocks, line)
        end
    end
    
    return join(julia_code_blocks, "\n")
end
```

This function processes the input string line-by-line, checking for the start and end of code blocks and specifically looking for blocks that are tagged with `julia`. It accumulates the lines of Julia code and finally joins them into a single string separated by newlines.
